intro: Hieracium amblyterodon, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a common weed in some regions.
